intro: Sibbalda, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plants typically have thick, velvety leaves and are often cultivated as ornamental plants. Sibbalda species are often grown in pots due to their preference for well-drained soil and indirect light. They are popular for their ability to bloom continuously throughout the year under proper care.
